qas.question: What does the Cross River State area of Nigeria have the world's largest variety of?
Southern Nigeria is turning from a forest to what type of environment?
What type of monkey is only found in parts of Nigeria and Cameroon?
What ecoregion is in Nigeria near the Cameroon border?
Why is southern Nigeria losing its forests?

answers.text: development and harvesting by increased population

context: The area near the border with Cameroon close to the coast is rich rainforest and part of the <a3_0>Cross-Sanaga-Bioko coastal forests<a3_0/> ecoregion, an important centre for biodiversity. It is habitat for <a2_0>the drill monkey<a2_0/>, which is found in the wild only in this area and across the border in Cameroon. The areas surrounding Calabar, Cross River State, also in this forest, are believed to contain the world's largest diversity of <a0_0>butterflies<a0_0/>. The area of southern Nigeria between the Niger and the Cross Rivers has lost most of its forest because of <a4_0>development and harvesting by increased population<a4_0/>, with it being replaced by <a1_0>grassland<a1_0/> (see Cross-Niger transition forests).
